title: [K-12] Teacher Learning Design Competency Strengthening Program Based on Digital Innovation and Neuroscience

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and digital tool utilization experience
context.additional_context: Mathematics-focused collaborative learning environment, featuring fully digital-equipped classrooms and online learning platform support.

learning_goals: Teachers design a 1-period middle school math lesson (equations, functions) using AI tools (ChatGPT, GeoGebra) and interactive content (Quizlet, Desmos), then demonstrate a lesson meeting ≥4 of 5 peer-review rubric criteria.
Develop at least three mathematics teaching strategies applying neuroscience-based learning principles (attention, working memory, executive function, emotional regulation)
Co-create at least two curriculum improvement proposals through collaborative design processes in professional learning communities (PLCs)

Learners analyze six months of formative data (quizzes, assignments) to identify ≥3 learner types (visual, auditory, etc.) and implement a simple AI system in Python/Scratch generating customized feedback messages.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
